title: [$250] Expense violation RBR is not pushed reliably to all platforms

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: Hot Pick
labels.description: Ready for an engineer to pick up and run with

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.81 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1764776788377499 ## Action Performed: Break down in numbered steps Pre-requisite: A workspace with max expense amount setup, 2 Devices signed in to the same account 1. On Device A, scan a receipt with amount higher that the max allowed amount so the violation is triggered 2. Wait for the receipt to smartscan 3. Verify that on the Device A you get the RBR in LHN on the transaction thread since the expense amount is over the limit ## Expected Result: Describe what you think should've happened On Device B, you should also get RBR on that same expense/ transaction thread notifying the user about the violation ## Actual Result: Describe what actually happened On Device B, there is not RBR pushed, it only shows once you visit the expense report ## Workaround: Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround? ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
During https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76343 it was figured out that a navigation bug in iOS is fixed in the new version of react-native-pager-view. I decided we update the version in a different issue just so we can get the PR out and avoid any unintended consequences.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.79-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2403/folder/13176933/41237704/1080012348 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Windows 10/Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Preconditions: User is an admin Workspace with set up delay submission: Manual and Approval enabled Steps: 1. Open the NewDot app 2. Navigate to the Workspace chat, select Create expense -> Scan Receipt 3. Upload the receipt pdf with an amount is 0.00 4. Wait until the receipts have been scanned finish 5. Click Submit the new report with 0.00 amount 6. Click Approve the report ## Expected Result: The new report should display the View button when the amount is 0.00 ## Actual Result: The user can submit and approve the 0.00 report ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/918c58b9-c3fa-4eda-af02-6d3948d62c00 [Bug7031799_1765951386457!PDF_receipt.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/24216205/Bug7031799_1765951386457.PDF_receipt.pdf) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.79-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76510 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+153gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Pull Request QA execution **Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: - Owner create a workspace and invite account A and B as members. Set account A as non-admin Approver. Account B is still member - Member create 2 reports with 1-2 expenses in each report 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. As approver, navigate to member's workspace chat 3. Scroll to second report 4. Open second report 5. Click on 'More' ## Expected Result: Approver is able to see the submit button in submitter expense report ## Actual Result: 'View' is shown at second report preview. 'Submit' button disappears in More menu in report ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/36c6706d-c4d4-40de-b7cd-45e83a865ad1 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Reports - "Reset Filters" is not displayed on filters page when "Group By" filter is applied

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.79-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2402/folder/13176922/41237509/1080011226 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2230@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 3. Tap on "Filters" 4. Open any filter except "Group By" and apply any option. 5. Note that after selected filter is saved, a "Reset Filters" option appears on the top right corner on filters page. 6. Reset the applied filter. 7. Tap on "Group By" and select any option. 8. Tap on "Save" 9. When landing on filters page, note that "Reset Filters" option is not displayed on the top right corner. ## Expected Result: When user applies any advanced filter, a "Reset Filters" option should be visible on the top right corner on filters page. ## Actual Result: When user applies the "Group By" advanced filter, "Reset Filters" option is not visible on the top right corner on filters page. "Reset Filters" option is visible when any other advanced filter is applied. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9cadeb80-f728-4712-ac5e-9f6c50ef9e63 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** v9.2.79-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2403/folder/13176933/41237702/1080012346?issue_type=jira https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/76037
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Pixel 7 Pro/Android 16
**App Component:** Chat Report View

## Action Performed:
Precondition: User has scanned a receipt into the Workspace chat 
1. Open the NewDot app
2. Navigate the receipt 
3. Edit the amount to a higher amount (note that a warning appears)
4. Tap on the preview to display the full receipt
5. Tap on the rotate button 
6. Return to the expense detail

## Expected Result:
The RBR warning remains

## Actual Result:
The RBR disappears after rotate the receipt

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
